details: clear the scratch directory before starting a new run? (TRUE or FALSE)
maximum number of species evaluated at the same time for a single N-SDM run (usefull to prevent scratch saturation)
[optional] name of the .csv file stored in the the /scripts/project/main/settings folder containing the names of species to be modelled (one per row)
presence only (po) or presence absence (pa) for local data
presence only (po) or presence absence (pa) for global data
minimum number of occurrences required for modelling a species for local level
minimum number of occurrences required for modelling a species for global level
do spatial and/or temporal disagregation of local species data (TRUE or FALSE)
do spatial and/or temporal disagregation of global species data (TRUE or FALSE)
[optional] distance for spatial thinning of loac species occurrence data  (in projection system unit)
[optional] time interval for temporal thinning of local species occurrence data (in years)
[optional] cutoff threshold for maximum coordinate uncertainty in local species occurrence data (in projection system unit)
[optional] distance for spatial thinning of global species occurrence data  (in projection system unit)
[optional] time interval for temporal thinning of global species occurrence data (in years)
[optional] cutoff threshold for maximum coordinate uncertainty in global species occurrence data (in projection system unit)
[if pa_po_loc or _glo = "po"] the strategy for generating pseudoabsences. Only the "random" option is available at the time of N-SDM release
[if pa_po_loc or _glo = "po"] the number of background absences to be generated
binary (0-1) .rds raster mask stored in the /data/project/mask folder used for identifying the local-level area (pixel value=1)
[optional] covariates considered as "observational" and set to an homogeneous value for the prediction process (format is full covariate name without attribute)
[if cov_observ exists] the value to which observational covariates will be set. Three options are available at the time of N-SDM release: "median", "zero" or "max"
[optional] covariate category_dataset with focal windows available (format is "category_dataset")
[optonal] covariate category_dataset with temporal dynamic (format is "category_dataset")

[optional] name of the .xlsx pre-filtering correspondence table stored in the the /scripts/project/main/settings folder indicating which covariates are candidate for modelling a target “class” of species
do temporal matching for global-level analyses? (TRUE or FALSE)
do temporal matching for local-level analyses? (TRUE or FALSE)
[if tmatch_glo = TRUE] scheme for temporal matching of global-level data. Two options are available at the time of N-SDM release: nearest-previous time slice "npts"or nearest time slice "nts"
[if tmatch_loc = TRUE] scheme for temporal matching of local-level data. Two options are available at the time of N-SDM release: nearest-previous time slice "npts"or nearest time slice "nts"
univariate ranking method used for colinearity filtering. Only the "GLM" option has been validated at the time of N-SDM release. Explore the nsdm.covfilter.R function for more options
Pearson correlation coefficient cutoff threshold used for colinearity filtering
maximum possible number of covariates in a single model
name of the .xlsx file stored in the the /scripts/project/main/settings folder containing the grid for hyperparameter tunning
name(s) of the modelling algorithms evaluated. Available options include "glm", "gam", "max", "rf", "gbm" and "esm"
[if "esm" included in mod_algo] total number of covariates evaluated in the esm framework
[if "esm" included in mod_algo] number of covariates combined in each esm
[if "esm" included in mod_algo] cutoff threshold value for "best_met" under which a model is discarded from the esm set
cross-validation strategy. Only the "splitsample" option is available at the time of N-SDM release
criteria for threshold dependant evaluation metrics. Only the "maxTSS" option is available at the time of N-SDM release

model evaluation metric used for identifying best models. Available options include "AUC", "AUC'", "Boyce", "Score", "Sensitivity", "Specificity", "Accuracy", "PPV", "NPV", "Jaccard", "TSS", "Kappa", "SEDI"
weight modelling algorithms by the value of weight_metric when ensembling? (TRUE or FALSE)
evaluation metric used for weighting and discarding models in the ensembling process
cutoff threshold for weight_met at which a model is discarded from the ensembling process
scale-nesting strategy applied for combining the global- and local-level models. The two available options at the time of N-SDM release are "covariate" and "multiply"
[optional] binary (0-1) .rds raster mask stored in the /data/project/mask folder used for masking the predictions [pixels with 0 value]
names of the future/alternative scenarios evaluated for projections (must match with covariate folder names; see Appendix S1: Text S2 for details)
names of the future/alternative periods evaluated for projections (must match with covariate folder names; see Appendix S1: Text S2 for details)
command arguments, not supposed to be modified
array identifier, not supposed to be modified
